docs.lead_paragraph: DR. ERIC SMALL, director of the Sports Medicine Center for young athletes at Blythedale Children's Hospital in Valhalla, recalled a recent phone call from a mother who wanted to know whether he thought her 3-year-old daughter, a patient who her mother said had decided to make dance a career, should add a fourth weekly ballet lesson. "What the mother didn't tell me," he said, "was if the child was enjoying herself." Dr. Small, who heads one of only five sports medicine centers for young athletes in the United States, has faced similar situations throughout the years since he has been in this field. He wants to see a young athlete succeed and enjoy the process as well.
